channel.title: Cultural Credits Events
channel.description: Stetson University's Cultural Credits Calendar of Events

item.title: *60 Years of Russia at Stetson*
item.description: Come celebrate 60 years of Russia at Stetson! Ongoing exhibit until May 2, 2018. Where: SPREES Center (249 E. Michigan Ave - DeLand) When: March 16 - May 2 from 9 am to 3 pm (CLOSED Saturdays/Sundays and Friday, March 30) Contact: Mayhill Fowler (mfowler@stetson.edu) Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *Citizen + Science: Pollinator Project at Gillespie Museum*
*Senior Exhibition II (Digital Arts)*
item.description: 2018 Creative Arts Senior Art Exhibition II, featuring work by graduating seniors in Digital Arts.

item.title: *The "Gun Show Loophole" and Beyond: Evaluating gun policy in the United States*
item.description: With the heightened attention to mass shootings in the United States, it is important for individuals to understand laws related to the possession, ownership, and use of firearms. Led in discussion by a retired attorney and a licensed firearms dealer, attendees will learn about local, state, and federal firearms laws, including addressing common myths about current law as well as analyzing various policy options for addressing firearm-related incidents in the United States. Where: Sage room 213 When: May 2, 2018 from 6 pm to 7:30 pm Cultural Credit Approved

item.title: *Senior Exhibition II (Digital Arts)*
item.description: 2018 Creative Arts Senior Art Exhibition II, featuring work by graduating seniors in Digital Arts.
